Mar 13, 2015

Highrise to Zoho Migration: Automated Solution to A Knotty Problem

Free Ebook Inside: ‘Why, When and How to Migrate Your CRM?’

Insights into customers’ needs lay a cornerstone for the business strategy development, and building of far-reaching customer relationships. CRM software aids companies in data management and facilitation of cumbersome processes. Besides, cloud hosted platforms enable vendors with the opportunity to cut down their expenses on the expensive hardware and IT staff.

Recently, SaaS became a practical innovation that increases the uptime, and offers 24/7 access to the company database from any corner of the world, on condition there is a connection to the Internet. Such solutions as Highrise and Zoho take up the top places of practical apps in business running.

Highrise vs Zoho: Set A New Start in Customer Relationship Building

Information provides you with a power, yet you have to arrange it properly to make sense of the piles of various records. Highrise and Zoho appeared nearly at the same time and were created to enhance the complications with data, day-to-day tasks and manual work. However, many vendors prefer to move from Highrise to Zoho. Let’s compare these platforms and find out the reasons.

Optimize Your Efforts

Highrise provides its users a comprehensive contact manager that enables records storage as a separate person and as a company or organization. As well, you can add links on the Twitter and LinkedIn pages.

Zoho comes to this task more specifically. The solution offers you a lead, contact and account management that qualify and distribute your prospects according to different criteria. Also, Zoho represents a social CRM and incorporates the most popular networks into sales and marketing processes.

System Usability for Extending Borders

For in-house management, Highrise provides you with task tool that helps to cope with the workload and assign various activities to your employees. Besides, it has a deals feature that helps to define the status of the company’s opportunities.

In contrast to Highrise, Zoho offers you an automation tool that allows you to create unique workflows and handle day-to-day activities. Apart from potentials and campaigns, there is a report feature for calculating ROI, monitoring the company performance and future project planning. Zoho provides a built-in file sharing and inside network for collaboration improvement.

In a nutshell, Highrise gives in the capabilities of Zoho. Moreover, the limited customization and integration options don’t bring points in favour of Highrise. Even growing companies look for a scope of scalability and improvement and decide to switch their data from Highrise to Zoho.

Whys and Wherefores of An Automated Migration

A lot of vendors suffer the extra expenses because of the fear to switch their records. Data transfer is a complex process that requires some technical skills, time and efforts. However, the automated online service Data2CRM may migrate your records in a quick, direct and accurate manner. There is no human interaction, plugin installations or system downtime. Process is fast and secure. Besides, you can run a free demo to see Data2CRM in action.

Blend Speed and Quality in Highrise to Zoho Data Switch

Step 1. Register your Data2CRM account at app.data2crm.com and provide your name, email, password, and a phone number.

Step 2. Specify your Highrise URL and API token.

To find your API token, log in your admin account, go to Account & setting and select My Info.

Then click on API token and copy/paste it in the corresponding field of the migration wizard.

Step 3. Define your Zoho mail and a password. All the access details are specifically encrypted and used only for a migration process, so you shouldn’t worry about your data security.

Step 4. Select entities you want to transfer (accounts, contacts, tasks and opportunities). If you want to migrate other CRM modules, contact with Data2CRM account manager.

Step 5. Set up a free demo and service will switch up to 20 items of each entity you have chosen.

Step 6. Start a full Highrise to Zoho migration.

Use your time wisely and launch a free demo migration instead of burning a hole in your head with the neverending considerations.
